lyrics.text: The World in Words
(Verse 1)
Words... they craft a cage,
Thoughts locked down, restrained by age.
Soft edges blur, then shift away,
Leaving truths too faint to stay.
What's real fits within the line,
But what's twisting outside the mind.
(Refrain)
What is said is sad,
What is not is lost.
Between sentences... the world halts.
And what lies beneath the thought?
(Verse 2)
A line divides what we see,
Symbols haunt, sharp and free.
Not meaning, not sounds—
But forms that bind, then freaking around.
erased once more, A boundary drawn.
(Verse 3)
Is my intent the same as yours?
Or does it mean something more?
Locked doors in every phrase,
Feeling's trace left dimmed and dazed.
(Chorus)
What we see—what we say,
They call you genius every day.
Even Russell couldn't tell what you meant,
But I know you're the loneliest heir ever sent.
(Outro)
Amidst the lies, you chose the quiet
A world undefined, left in the riot.
Without you, maybe no AI.
Yet so many glanced, letting you pass by..
